bill.title: First Responder Appreciation and Recruitment Act; create.
bill.description: An Act To Create The "first Responder Appreciation And Recruitment Act"; To Create A New Section In Title 25, Chapter 11, Article 3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Implement The "first Responders Retirement Incentive"; To Provide, For This Incentive, That Any Member Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Hired On Or After July 1, 2011, Shall Earn One Year Of Creditable Service At No Cost To Members For Every Five Years Served As A First Responder In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide That, In Order To Use This Incentive, The First Responder Must Not Have Any Felony Convictions At The Time Of Retirement; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105, 25-11-109, 25-11-111, 25-11-113, 25-11-114 And 25-11-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Vesting Period For Retirement Benefits In The Public Employees' Retirement System From Eight Years To Four Years For Persons Having Joined The System On Or After July 1, 2007, But Having At Least Four Years Of Service In The System As First Responders; And For Related Purposes.
